section.title: Which version shoul I use?
section.para: Before you install a version of Code::Blocks, you need to have some knowledge of the diffrent versions of Code::Blocks. There are basicly three diffrent versions:
The stable version of Code::Blocks is well the well tested version of Code::Blocks and most of the time the recommended version.

The Nightly build provides the latest features, bug fixes and probably new bugs. It is used to let the community test Code::Blocks. It is not advisable to use this version in a production environment.
The Source code is for people who knows what they are doing and for Linux users who can't find a packages for a specific distribution.

section.title: Download
section.para: You can download Code::Blocks from the website codeblocks.org There are two diffrent versions. One with and one without MinGW.
If you don't have any compiler installed, or just want to start quickly, you should download the vesion with MinGW.

section.title: Download
section.para: The nightly build is also available on the website of Code::Blocks. !!!link!!!

section.title: install
section.para: To install the nightly build you need to have 7-Zip, or another program that could handle 7-Zip files. The archive that is downloaded could be unpacked in any folder you like.
